column3: Sextus Julius Silvanus, son of Sextus
column9: If the reconstruction of Forum Iuli is correct (the monument is now lost), it could refer to Cividale del Friuli (Italia), Fréjus (Gallia Narbonensis), Voghera (Italia)

column3: Lucius Vettius Secundus, son of Marcus

column9: Unsure if Augusta Praetoria (Italia) or Augusta Troas (Asia Minor). Tončinić 2011, 204-205; Fadić 1995 168: Troas may be more likely, as Sergia is a common tribe for Asia Minor citizens, and another Member (Gaius Curiatius) does list Augusta Troas as his place of origin (MonumentID 32, CIL 3, 2019).
Domicile is lost as inscription is fragmentary

column3: Lucius Domitius Aquila, son of Lucius
Gaius Domitius Aquilinus, son of Lucius
column9: Stela does not explicitly mention that Gaius from Mylia, but his father/brother commemorated on the same monument is from Mylias

column3: Titus Elvius Salinator, son of Titus
column9: Titus' father, Titus, is recorded to have been part of the Scaptia tribe, so Titus Elvius may be a member of the same tribe

It is not certain that Lucius was a member of Legio VII, for the inscription does not explicitly mention service, but it is fragementary and damaged. It was found in the durrounds of tilurium however, and is of a similar style to other stelae of Legio VII members. Tončinić 2011: 37-38

column3: Lucius Fabius Saturninus, son of Lucius
Quintus Igneinus Ferox, son of Quintus
column9: Quintus may be a Legio VII member, it is not explicit in his stela however. This possibility is reinforced by the fact that Legio VII member Gaius Curitatus is from Augusta Troas #32, CIL 3, 2109
Mitchell 1976: n.50 suggests the name is similar to several other found in Galatia

column3: Gaius Julius Agrippa, son of Gaius
column9: Other members of Sergia tribe are predominantly from Asia Minor, Tončinić 2011.
Tončinić 2011: 205 purports that this 'city' is likely a ethnic name (nomen ethnicom), and the locaiton is unknown.
No mention of Legio VII as the stelae is damaged. However, style is the same as many other stelae belonging to servicemen of the legio, and it was found at Tilurium.
Tončinić 2011, 50: Could also be Heraclea Macedonia (Betz 1938 and Wilkes 1969), but Fadić 1997 notes that all other extant members of Macedonian decent are of the Voltinia or Aemilia tribe.
